entities.name: AZURE
entities.description: Azure is a comprehensive set of cloud services offering developers, IT professionals, and enterprises the freedom to build, deploy, and manage applications on any platform or device. Azure enables customers to devote more resources to development and use of applications that benefit their organizations, rather than managing on-premises hardware and software.

entities.name: MICROSOFT
entities.description: Microsoft provides a range of services including Server products and cloud services, Enterprise Services, Premier Support Services, and Microsoft Consulting Services.

entities.name: GITHUB
entities.description: GitHub provides a collaboration platform and code hosting service for developers.

entities.name: AMAZON
entities.description: Amazon competes with Azure in cloud services.

entities.name: GOOGLE
entities.description: Google competes with Azure in cloud services.

entities.name: IBM
entities.description: IBM competes with Azure in cloud services and also offers server operating systems and applications.

entities.name: ORACLE
entities.description: Oracle competes with Azure in cloud services and also offers server operating systems and applications.

entities.name: VMWARE
entities.description: VMware competes with Azure in cloud services.

entities.name: HEWLETT-PACKARD
entities.description: Hewlett-Packard offers its own versions of the Unix operating system preinstalled on server hardware.

entities.name: RED HAT
entities.description: Red Hat supplies versions of Linux.

entities.name: CA TECHNOLOGIES
entities.description: CA Technologies competes with Microsoft server applications for PC-based distributed client-server environments.

relationships.relationship_description: Azure is a cloud service offered by Microsoft.
GitHub is a collaboration platform and code hosting service owned by Microsoft.
Azure competes with Amazon in cloud services.
Azure competes with Google in cloud services.
Azure competes with IBM in cloud services.
Azure competes with Oracle in cloud services.
Azure competes with VMware in cloud services.
Microsoft competes with IBM in server operating systems and applications.
Microsoft competes with Oracle in server operating systems and applications.
Hewlett-Packard offers its own versions of the Unix operating system preinstalled on server hardware, competing with Microsoft's server products.
Red Hat supplies versions of Linux, competing with Microsoft's server products.
CA Technologies competes with Microsoft's server applications for PC-based distributed client-server environments.
